note.p: Education: Christ's Hospital (1799); Pembroke College, Cambridge. BA (1792)

Career: Ordained (1792); curate of Gainsborough (1792); Rector of Tansor (1795); Rector of Bytham (1802); Prebendary of Lincoln (1809); Archdeacon of Huntingdon; Vicar of St Pancras; Bishop of Calcutta, so went to India (1814); visited Cochin (1821); died of fever; "house" at Christ' Hospital named after him
Notes: Alternative spelling, Fanshaw, from DNB. 'Saml Carlisle' is Samuel Goodenough, Bishop of Carlisle
